description: Prime Minister François Bayrou will put his government's survival on the line on Monday in a confidence vote. Faced with a seemingly inevitable defeat, the rest of the cabinet has reacted with confusion and bitterness.

headline: Shooting at Jerusalem bus stop kills at least six, according to Israeli paramedics
description: Two attackers opened fire at a busy intersection in north Jerusalem. Paramedics said an additional 15 people were injured, including six in serious condition.

headline: Marine Le Pen's appeal trial to be held in January-February 2026
description: The leader of the French far right is appealing a conviction of embezzlement, for which she was banned from running in elections and handed a four-year prison sentence, two of which were suspended.

headline: Frédéric Péchier, an anesthesiologist accused of 30 poisonings, goes on trial
description: The 53-year-old doctor's criminal trial is set to begin on Monday. According to the investigating judges, whose accusations he has denied, he was 'the common denominator' in a long series of 'serious adverse events.'

headline: UNRWA head Philippe Lazzarini: 'There is a risk we'll get used to what I see as a deliberate and manufactured famine'
description: The commissioner general of the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees tells Le Monde that countries have an 'extremely broad range' of options to 'stop all the atrocities being committed' in the enclave.

'Block Everything': While September 10 movement echoes the Yellow Vests, it also has key differences
description: While the call to 'block everything' on Wednesday, September 10, brings to mind the Yellow Vest protests of 2018, the choice of a weekday, the involvement of unions, and the support of left-wing parties give this social movement its own distinct character.

headline: Fashion retreats from diversity: 'We are again being openly asked for Caucasian models'
description: Until recently, the industry enthusiastically embraced the major social issues stirring society. From supporting Pride to Black Lives Matter, to championing inclusivity in the representation of bodies and identities, fashion seemed in tune with the times. But the tide has turned. The election of Donald Trump, who issued a series of anti-diversity executive orders, has changed everything.

headline: Did Macron really add €1 trillion to France's national debt?
description: While this figure often cited by opposition parties is misleading, France's debt has risen significantly under Emmanuel Macron's presidency, partly due to his tax policy decisions.
